intro: Parrya seravschanica, commonly known as the Karakoram parrya, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas and Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic compounds. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, adapting to cold and arid conditions. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided foliage, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Parrya seravschanica is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
